paper: Scaling Laws for Uncertainty in Deep Learning

differences.summary: Scaling-law notation/sign inconsistency (1/N^{γ} vs negative γ)
differences.why_impacts_score: Undermines correctness of scaling fits and extrapolation; reduces clarity and trust

evidence.baseline_quote: Linear regression on log–log plots is used without goodness-of-fit diagnostics.
evidence.final_quote: internal inconsistency between '1/N^{γ}' stated in captions and reported negative γ values.

differences.summary: Theoretical sign inconsistency between Eq. (10) and Appendix Eq. (31)
differences.why_impacts_score: Raises doubts about theoretical correctness; weakens explanatory bridge

evidence.baseline_quote: No alignment between measured γ values and theoretical predictions is attempted, reducing explanatory power.
evidence.final_quote: Eq. (10) presents a negative sum, whereas Appendix Eq. (31) gives a positive sum.

differences.summary: Clarity score downgraded due to notation and equation inconsistencies
differences.why_impacts_score: Explicit reason for lowering clarity score; hurts readability and consistency

evidence.baseline_quote: Clarity (10): 8 — Metrics and methods are clearly defined; figures are annotated.
evidence.final_quote: Clarity (10): 7 — inconsistent scaling-law notation and Eq. (10) vs Appendix mismatch hinder readability.

differences.summary: Overall assessment cites added inconsistencies (notation and theory signs)
differences.why_impacts_score: Adds extra flaws to overall justification; makes final assessment harsher

evidence.baseline_quote: Overall (10): 7 — limited statistical rigor and theory restricted to linear models.
evidence.final_quote: Overall (10): 7 — additional inconsistencies in scaling-law notation and generalization error signs.
